--- title: "1.2 — The Smithean View of Trade: Divison of Labor — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Date *Thursday, January 26, 2023* ::: ## Overview Today we look at Adam Smith's understanding of what is the cause of the wealth of nations: the division of labor. ## Readings ### Recommended Reading - [ Smith (1776), *Wealth of Nations*, Book I, Chs. 1-3](https://www.econlib.org/library/Smith/smWN.html) - [ Safner (2023), “It All Beings with the Division of Labor: Meditations on what should be the central insight of economics”](https://increasingreturns.substack.com/p/it-all-begins-with-the-division-of) - [ Safner (2023), “Division of Labor vs. the Invisible Hand: Two divergent trajectories of economic thought from two of its foundations”](https://increasingreturns.substack.com/p/division-of-labor-vs-the-invisible) - [ Munger (2007), "I'll Stick With These: Some Sharp Observations on the Division of Labor"](https://www.econlib.org/library/Columns/y2007/Mungerpins.html) - [ Bauer (2000), "From Subsistence to Exchange"](/readings/Bauer-2000-Ch1.pdf) - [ TED Talk: Thomas Thwaites: How I Built a Toaster From Scratch"](https://www.ted.com/talks/thomas_thwaites_how_i_built_a_toaster_from_scratch?language=en) - [ YouTube: How to Make a $1500 Sandwich in Only 6 Months"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=URvWSsAgtJE) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats.
